results.title: Rock Hudson's home movies
results.brief_description: This documentary takes the film-clip biography to new heights. Narrated by ‘Rock’ it wittily dissects the late star’s screen career in the light of the now known facts of his life— that he was gay and died from AIDS. The film presents a new image of Hollywood’s leading romantic screen idol of the 50s and 60s by closely examining his screen roles for ‘hidden meanings’ Both poignant and funny it exposes the ‘queerness’ the sits just below the surface of mainstream Hollywood film.

results.title: Wonderful world of the Brothers Grimm
results.creator_credit: Henry Levin, George Pal, Cinerama, Gallen Films and Turner Entertainment
results.brief_description: Brothers Wilhelm and Jacob Grimm (Laurence Harvey and Karl Boehm) are commissioned to write a family history for a local Duke; the setting, the nineteenth century. The task seems doomed as Wilhelm is far more content creating stories about fairies, elves, knights and princesses to include in a collection of folktales. Jacob reluctantly agrees to help his brother, provided it doesn’t interfere with the serious task at hand. This fictionalised account of two of the world’s greatest story tellers is interspersed with adaptations of some of their stories. An international cast brings to life some of the Brothers Grimms’ best loved fairy tales including “The Dancing Princess”, “The Cobbler and the elves” and “The Singing bone”. The cast of these fairy tales includes Claire Bloom, Karl Boehm, Walter Slezak, Oscar Homolka, Barbara Eden, Yvette Mimieux, Jim Backus and Beulah Bondi. A delightful account that will be enjoyed by viewers of all ages.

results.title: Gabbeh
results.creator_credit: Mohsen Makhmalbaf, Khalil Daroudchi, Khalil Mahmoudi, MK2 Productions and Sanayeh Dasti
results.brief_description: With “Gabbeh” Mohsen Makhmalbaf creates a romantic parable of universal resonance. A gabbeh is an Iranian carpet produced by the nomadic Ghashghai tribe of southern Iran. This episodic tale is framed with exquisite interludes on the colours of nature, painting each scene with landscapes and vistas of breathtaking beauty.

results.title: Donnie Brasco
results.creator_credit: Mike Newell, Barry Levinson, Gail Mutrux, Louis Digiamo, Mark Johnson and Mandalay Entertainment
results.brief_description: This is a gangster movie quite like no other which is more concerned with character study, friendship and betrayal. Donnie Brasco (Johnny Depp), also known as Joe the Jeweller, befriends Mafia small man and former assassin Lefty Ruggiero (Al Pacino). Lefty sees in the young Donnie a chance to rise in the Mafia ranks, something the aging Lefty, with his drug addicted son and passive wife is no longer capable of. Unbeknown to Lefty, Donnie Brasco is an under cover special agent, working with the FBI to infiltrate the New York Mafia underworld. What at first seems a simple case of undercover work is complicated by Donnie’s genuine feelings of friendship towards Lefty and Lefty’s loyalty towards Donnie. Based on the book by Joseph D. Pistone with Richard Woodley. Also starring Michael Madsen, Bruno Kirby, James Russo and Anne Heche.

results.title: Wilde
results.creator_credit: Brian Gilbert, Marc Samuelson, Peter Samuelson, INDF International and Samuelson Entertainment
results.brief_description: In this world there are only two tragedies. One is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it (Oscar Wilde). Stephen Fry stars as Oscar Wilde, one of the most controversial writers of our time. A man brimming with wit and honesty, but a life tragically plagued by scandal. This video traces the rise and fall of Oscar, including; his relationship with Lord Alfred Douglas, “Bosie” (Jude Law), and the loving relationships he had with his devoted wife, Constance (Jennifer Ehle) and two children, and his publicized trial and imprisonment. What emerges is a portrait of a man of incredible literary talent, fierce love and passion, loved by those of whom he gave his affection but ultimately denigrated by conservative society for his perceived amoral and hedonistic lifestyle.

results.title: The Celluloid closet
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Friedman, Rob Epstein and Reflective Image
results.brief_description: Vito Russo’s seminal text on homosexual representation in Hollywood cinema has been faithfully adapted for the screen by Rob Epstein and Jeffrey Friedman who also made the documentaries” The Times of Harvey Milk” and “Common threads: Stories from the quilt”. Narrated by Lily Tomlin and featuring interviews with Susan Sarandon, Gore Vidal, Tom Hanks, Quentin Crisp, Tony Curtis, Harvey Fierstein, Whoopi Goldberg, Susi Bright, Richard Dyer and Amistad Maupin (who also wrote Lily Tomlin’s voice over narration), “The Celluloid closet” covers ambitious ground, that being Hollywoods difficult relationship with showing homosexual desire openly and honestly. This informative documentary also demonstrates how certain films were modified through such means as the puritanical Hayes code which was set up to stamp out any hint of ‘sexual perversion’ from the screen. The film also goes on to discuss how homosexuality was then coded and subverted in order to pass unnoticed by the censors. Featuring clips from “Ben Hur”, “Johnny Guitar”, “Calamity Jane”, “The Childrens Hour”, “Boys in the band”, “Tea and Sympathy”, “Suddenly last summer”, “Some like it hot”, “Rebel without a cause”, “Personal best” and “Cruising”.

results.title: In & out = In and out
results.creator_credit: Frank Oz, Scott Rudin, Spelling Films and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Howard Brackett (Kevin Kline) is about to come out, big time, on National Television, only he doesn’t know it. School teacher Brackett, along with family and friends are watching the Academy Awards when one of his former students makes a revealing acceptance speech when he wins the award for best actor. He thanks his former teacher, Brackett, as providing the inspiration behind his award winning role as a gay soldier. This is startling news to Howard, his fiancee (Joan Cusack), but seems to explain things to Howard’s students and friends who seem to have found an explanation for Howard’s neat ways and Streisand fascination. Howard is desperate to get married to refute his sexuality but hot on his tail is the national press and in particular is an aggressive television reporter (Tom Selleck), who wants Howard to come out for himself on television. Howard has some thinking to do. Cast includes Debbie Reynolds, Matt Dillon, Wilford Brimley and Bob Newhart.

results.title: Blue eyed
results.brief_description: Blue eyed is a confronting documentary which follows Jane Elliott at work as she conducts a workshop about prejudice and racism. She does this by dividing her audience into two groups; blue eyed and brown eyed as uses the colour distinction to demonstrate the powerful impact of discrimination and the effect is has on the victim’s emotions. Designed for use by schools and businesses to illustrate the anatomy of prejudice and the effects of racism.

results.title: Passage home
results.creator_credit: Roy Baker, Julian Wintle and Group Film Productions
results.brief_description: The steamer, “Bulinga” is the setting of this tense journey which takes the viewer on a passage from South America to England. The steamer is laden with pedigree bulls and Captain Lucky Ryland (Peter Finch) is pushing his crew to complete the trip in record breaking time. Adding to Lucky’s lack of cohesion with his crew members is the presence of Ruth (Diane Cilento), a passenger they have received orders to carry. Lucky raises the wrath of the first mate when he saves Ruth from being attacked by Lucky during one of his drunken binges. Lucky becomes isolated from the rest of the crew and shirks away from his responsibilities, until a violent storm hits the boat and they must put aside their differences to work as a team and survive. Cast also includes Anthony Steel, Cyril Cusack, Geoffrey Keen and Hugh Griffith. Based on a novel by Richard Armstrong.

results.title: Joey
results.creator_credit: Ian Barry, Michael Lake and Village Roadshow Pictures
results.brief_description: Kangaroos hold a special place in Billy’s (Jamie Croft) heart, he even trespasses to protect them from being hunted on neighbouring Queensland farms. His evil neighbour, Dixon (Errol O’Neill) hires a Kanga Catcher who drugs the kangaroos and transports them to the city, all but a lonely joey who Billy rescues. Together with the daughter of an American ambassador, boy, girl and joey begin a journey to reunite the young kangaroo with its kidnapped family. An adventure film that the whole family will enjoy. Cast also includes Alex McKenna, Rebecca Gibney, Ed Begley Jr and Ruth Cracknell.
